definitions.text: the entire structure of an organism (an animal, plant, or human being)
examples: he felt as if his whole body were on fire

definitions.text: a group of persons associated by some common tie or occupation and regarded as an entity
examples: the whole body filed out of the auditorium

definitions.text: a natural object consisting of a dead animal or person
examples: they found the body in the lake

definitions.text: an individual 3-dimensional object that has mass and that is distinguishable from other objects
the body excluding the head and neck and limbs
examples: they moved their arms and legs and bodies

definitions.text: a collection of particulars considered as a system
the property of holding together and retaining its shape
examples: wool has more body than rayon
when the dough has enough consistency it is ready to bake

definitions.text: the central message of a communication
examples: the body of the message was short

definitions.text: the main mass of a thing
a resonating chamber in a musical instrument (as the body of a violin)
the external structure of a vehicle
examples: the body of the car was badly rusted

definitions.text: invest with or as with a body; give body to
